page.title: 17ALONG THE CANAL AT WOLVERLEY
page.content: {The Staffordshire and Worcestershire {Canal}runs South/North through the S.E. corner of Wolverley. It was built by{James Brindley}and completed in{1772}. There is one lock with a fall of about 3 metres.This is opposite{The {Lock}public house which was a local hostellry for canal people.Today it caters for holiday boats which use the canal. A bridge under the B4189 takes the canal South to the town of{Stourport following the valley of the{River {Stour}. Holiday makers often moor their boats near The Lock and visit the old village of Wolverley and its {sandstone cave houses}.
